name: Sundarbans Mangrove Forest
description: The world's largest mangrove forest and UNESCO World Heritage Site, home to the Royal Bengal Tiger and diverse wildlife. A natural wonder spanning both Bangladesh and India with unique ecosystems.

name: Cox's Bazar Beach
description: The world's longest natural sea beach stretching 120 kilometers along the Bay of Bengal. Famous for its golden sand, surfing opportunities, and stunning sunsets.

name: Shat Gombuj Mosque (Sixty Dome Mosque)
description: Historic 15th-century mosque and UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring 60 domes and 77 pillars. A masterpiece of Sultanate architecture and Islamic art in Bengal.

name: Paharpur Buddhist Monastery
description: Ancient Buddhist monastery and UNESCO World Heritage Site dating back to 8th century. Known as Somapura Mahavihara, it's one of the largest Buddhist monasteries south of the Himalayas.

name: Lalbagh Fort
description: 17th-century Mughal fort complex in Old Dhaka, featuring the tomb of Pari Bibi, Diwan-i-Aam, and beautiful gardens. An incomplete fort with rich Mughal architecture and history.

name: Ratargul Swamp Forest
description: The only freshwater swamp forest in Bangladesh, known as the 'Amazon of Bangladesh'. A unique ecosystem with tall trees standing in knee-deep water during monsoon.

name: Ahsan Manzil (Pink Palace)
description: 19th-century palace and former residence of the Nawab of Dhaka, now a museum showcasing the lifestyle of Bengal's aristocracy. Famous for its distinctive pink color and Indo-European architecture.

name: Saint Martin's Island
description: Bangladesh's only coral island, known for its crystal clear water, coral reefs, and pristine beaches. A tropical paradise perfect for snorkeling, diving, and relaxation.

name: Kantajew Temple
description: 18th-century Hindu temple renowned for its exquisite terracotta artwork and intricate architectural design. One of the finest examples of terracotta art in Bangladesh.

name: Jaflong Stone Collection Area
description: Scenic spot where the Piyain River meets the hills of Meghalaya, India. Famous for stone collection, crystal clear water, and stunning mountain views.

name: Mahasthangarh Archaeological Site
description: The earliest urban archaeological site in Bangladesh dating back to 3rd century BC. Known as Pundranagara in ancient times, it contains ruins of an ancient fortified city.

name: Kuakata Sea Beach
description: Panoramic sea beach where you can see both sunrise and sunset from the same location. Known as 'Sagar Kannya' (Daughter of the Sea), it's one of the rare beaches offering 360-degree sea views.

name: Rangamati Hill District
description: Scenic hill district with Kaptai Lake, tribal culture, and lush green hills. Home to various indigenous communities and offering boat cruises, hanging bridges, and cultural experiences.

name: Somapura Mahavihara (Paharpur)
description: Remains of the largest Buddhist monastery south of the Himalayas, built in the 8th century. UNESCO World Heritage Site showcasing ancient Buddhist architecture and sculpture.

name: Bandarban Hill District
description: Highest hill district in Bangladesh featuring Keokradong peak, tribal communities, waterfalls, and adventure tourism. Perfect for trekking, rock climbing, and cultural exploration.

name: Sitakunda Eco Park
description: Botanical garden and eco park at the foothills of Sitakunda range. Features diverse flora, medicinal plants, tribal culture, and the famous Chandranath Temple on the hilltop.

name: Nijhum Dwip National Park
description: Island national park in the Bay of Bengal known for spotted deer, migratory birds, and mangrove forests. A pristine natural habitat perfect for wildlife photography and eco-tourism.

name: Lalakhal Blue River
description: Crystal clear blue river flowing from the hills of Meghalaya, India. Famous for its transparent blue water, river cruises, and scenic beauty surrounded by hills and tea gardens.

name: Mainamati Archaeological Site
description: Ancient Buddhist cultural center with ruins of 50 Buddhist sites including Salban Vihara. Dating from 8th to 12th centuries, it showcases the Buddhist heritage of ancient Bengal.

name: Teknaf Wildlife Sanctuary
description: Coastal wildlife sanctuary at the southernmost tip of Bangladesh, home to Asian elephants, wild boars, and diverse bird species. Important conservation area for endangered wildlife.

name: Sreemangal Tea Gardens
description: Rolling tea estates and scenic green landscapes in the tea capital of Bangladesh. Ideal for nature walks, photography, and learning about tea culture.

name: Lawachara National Park
description: Protected tropical rainforest known for biodiversity, rare birds, and primates. A popular spot for eco-tourism and short forest treks.

name: Tanguar Haor
description: A vast wetland ecosystem famous for migratory birds, scenic haor landscapes, and boat journeys. One of Bangladesh's most important freshwater wetlands.

name: Sajek Valley
description: A hill-valley destination known for cloud views, sunrise scenery, and indigenous culture. Popular for short treks and panoramic viewpoints.

name: Boga Lake
description: A scenic highland lake in the Bandarban hills, popular for trekking and camping. Known for its tranquil water and surrounding peaks.

name: Bichnakandi Stone Quarry
description: A scenic river-and-hills landscape where clear streams meet stone beds. Popular for short trips, photography, and nature exploration.

name: Panam City (Sonargaon)
description: Historic merchant city area with colonial-era buildings and heritage lanes. A popular cultural destination near Dhaka for architecture and history lovers.

name: Puthia Temple Complex
description: A collection of historic Hindu temples featuring terracotta ornamentation and classic Bengal temple architecture. Known for serene surroundings and cultural heritage.

name: Foy's Lake
description: A popular lake and recreation area with boat rides, viewpoints, and family-friendly attractions in Chittagong. Known for calm waters and green surroundings.

name: Madhabkunda Waterfall
description: One of Bangladesh's largest waterfalls, surrounded by forest and hills. A popular destination for nature lovers, picnics, and photography.
